intro: Phacelia secunda subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces numerous seeds in its fluffy, blue-gray flower heads. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
